website_summaries.verdict: At about half the price of the Maxi Climber, it offers a good value and quality for the price.
pros: We like that it can easily be folded and store out of sight
Consumers pointed out its small, space-saving design and the fact that it offers two resistance levels
cons: A few reported issues with the computer panel malfunctioning, and some felt the compact design doesn't work well for taller individuals

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine until metal sheared at the pins during use.
customer_reviews.text: A functional, if pretty utilitarian, stepper. I thought it worked fine ...until the metal suddenly and catastrophically failed where the front leg meets the vertical frame, during use. I am not a large person and it has been used infrequently over the past year.
customer_reviews.author: A. Lux

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about this product being "cheap" due to the price, I am a fitness trainer, I dislike cheap equipment and while this isn't fitness club quality, it is pretty darn close. I am very pleased and absolutely love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Dallas Carey

customer_reviews.title: This thing kicks __^_^
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I have never had so much luck ...been using for 4 weeks and I have always had a flat butt..but now my butt is getting huge from this thing it takes me a little time to sweat though like 40 mins on level 10 but I'm in really good shape...ladiea If you want sexy legs and a bigger but get this thing even my daughter said mom your butt is getting nice and big...whoo hoo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looove this!!!
customer_reviews.text: I looove this machine. I've been needing to break a sweat since stuck at home in quarantine. The only complaint I have is the monitor not working properly. Just got it yesterday, so I'm going to read the instructions again, but this machine is awesome for the price. I break a good sweat, get my heart rate up, and with my fit bit, I'm good to go with the tracking. I can't wait for my husband and our 18 year old son to try this!
customer_reviews.author: Caro

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This stepper feels so cheap (because it is). Even though I'm only 120 pounds, I feel like I'm going to break it. It also makes really annoying noises while using it. I only used this product like 5 times before getting rid of it because I hated it so much. I would not recommend this for anybody
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth N

customer_reviews.title: Its permanently stuck.
customer_reviews.text: One petal is stuck down. I tried to fix the issue but it's as if someone glued it down. Its setting is 6. So its not set too low or high and the other petal works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this because I wasn't getting a good enough quad workout
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this because I wasn't getting a good enough quad workout, but was struggling with my knees (middle-aged knees). I wanted something for home which wasn't bulky (space-saver), was sturdy, and would work my quads while protecting my knees. I did quite a lot of research on this and opted to go with this product. Pleasantly impressed! Very sturdy, folds down easily, uses very little space in our home. It has 12 intensity settings, I'm currently using it on setting 8. Exactly what I wanted. Now, to see how long it lasts (I use it near daily). I've had it about a month and so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Gnomestead

customer_reviews.title: Works up a sweat.
customer_reviews.text: Video is my puppy freaking out about the stair stepper. I just did my first 60 minute workout and it was great. The stepper is quiet compared to most of the big gym ones I’ve used. I burned about 500 calories and worked up a sweat on the level 5 setting. It was sturdy and it stayed together. Took me less than 5 minutes to assemble and it was really easy. I’ll update my review in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah J Sederberg

customer_reviews.title: Take the negative reviews with a grain of salt.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what the complaints were about how wobbly this machine is. I think it's rock solid. Easy to assemble, I thought 30 minutes a day on my old recumbant bike was a workout. Nay. After 5 minutes on this thing I was trying to make excuses to quit. The instructoins recommended 10 minutes for beginners and build up slowly to 15. 10 minutes is a great workout for an old man. This was money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Grandpappy

customer_reviews.title: Space saving & butt kicking machine!!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant about buying the product since there were so many mixed reviews but so far so pleased I did get it! I bought the warranty package in case something were to happen to it soon. Assembly looked hard but actually not bad at all took me maybe 15 minutes. I put 4 for sturdiness since it is sturdy, but is pretty light weight and can at times feel it may fall over, but so far great! You really do feel the burn after a while. I was hoping to do 30 minutes a day but haven’t even been able to do 15 minutes straight!
customer_reviews.author: Tare Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Horrible plastic smell due to poor design.
customer_reviews.text: So far, the product is works as it should. But, after 30 minutes of use, there is a burning plastic smell which is not very pleasant or safe to inhale. It is because the pistons get too hot, and they start melting the plastic level adjustment knobs. I can see this being causing the knobs to break in the near future. I will update if I notice anything different.
customer_reviews.author: L.Ng

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: This stepper is a bargain. I tried a rower and just didn’t get a good workout from it. With this stepper I’m sweating in 15 minutes and drenched after 1/2 an hour. I also run a lot so my conditioning is pretty good. I highly recommend this stepper but go easy if you are just starting a fitness program.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Great cardio
customer_reviews.text: I was positively surprised. Crazy good cardio, will make you sweat while toning legs, glutes and calves.
customer_reviews.author: FL Boar

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic economial machine
customer_reviews.text: This is an initial review after having just unboxed this stepper, set it up, and completed one workout. First, it's incredibly easy to put together and comes mostly assembled. Second, it's not very heavy and you can move it around with ease but yet it's stable on a carpeted floor. But here's the best part... It's a good workout. My legs are shaking and I'm used to the arc trainer at my gym. If you put the tension up, this is a really good leg workout while also giving you cardio. At max tension it feels like I'm slogging through very heavy, thick mud. For the price this is an excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MLynn

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: Received 1’st unit, hardware ie washers loose in box, some washers missing; were an odd-shape that we did not have. Amazon sent me 2’nd unit. Set it up, computer unit did not work. Tried the computer from the 1’st unit and that does not work either. Units turn on, show zeros but no display ie time, calories etc. 2 units to return now.
customer_reviews.author: Leo White

customer_reviews.title: Best cardio machine at this price
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best cardio machine you can get at this price. It's also quiet, light, and compact. There are 2 minor issues though: -There isn't much adjustment range for the intensity. -The "shocks" can get very hot. I weigh about 200 pounds and probably in below average shape cardio wise. After about 15 minutes of medium intensity work, the shocks (or whatever they're called) are almost to hot to touch. Also, the hotter the shocks get the faster you're going to be working (they lose some resistance as they heat up). If you're heavier and/or want to use this machine for long high intensity workouts the shocks would be extremely hot and the reliability may suffer.
customer_reviews.author: cos born

customer_reviews.title: The legs are sturdy as well and do not shake
customer_reviews.text: Space-saving design and light enough to transport and maneuver. I had purchased this to use indoors with the coming winter months. The piston/hydraulic action is smooth and makes very little noise. For reference, I am 5' 10" and medium build, have no issues with knocking my knees on the pistons. The legs are sturdy as well and do not shake. Feels like a great workout, especially the core and balance if you are not using the bars for assistance. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: citizenmav787

customer_reviews.title: Walking at home
customer_reviews.text: At age 68 I do a one hour walk every morning, except Sundays. But I wanted an option to stay home and do minor exercise if it is raining, or too many people near my walk, or for upcoming cold Winter weather. Of course as you get older it's more of a challenge to maintain your strength. So at first I found this quite difficult to use with a very strong walking exercise. Then I experimented from 1 to 12. Believe it or not, 12 is the easiest if you're ok with short slower steps doing 10 to 20 minutes at a time. I am happy with this stair stepper
customer_reviews.author: Jacques Lebeau

customer_reviews.title: Handlebars are too short.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well built item. It is easy to assemble and works very well. It's only shortcoming is the handbar. It is too short and narrow. I am 5' 10" and my wife is 5' 4", and she is also dissatisfied with the handlebar. We both feel like we're leaning forward to grip the bar.
customer_reviews.author: carguy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome home machine
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, very stable machine. I workout often and this home machine kicks my bum. There's 12 intensity levels and I'm only on 5. After 15 minutes, I'm gross sweaty too. Working my way up to 20/30 minutes still. Super easy assembly too. I keep my phone in my pocket to keep track of the steps so they add to my daily 10k steps. Worth the buy!
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Very good product for small price but replacement parts are hard to get, if you can get them at all.
customer_reviews.text: I have PAD and poor circulation in my legs. This results in leg weakness. This simple machine really works the legs and has restored circulation and endurance to my legs without the cost and pain of surgery and stents. Well worth the money! Easily assembled but replacement parts seem almost impossible to get, Customer service only puts you on a waiting list for parts with no follow up! For this reason, you may want to consider another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Must buy
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought this earlier. I was skeptical because I am not really a "light cardio" kind of girl, I like intense stairclimber sessions at the gym. I will say that this is a stepper, you're not going to get the same effect as a stairclimber, but I really enjoy it and it is a decent enough substitute during a pandemic. It's pretty light, portable, doesnt take up a lot of room, has adjusting resistance. Was easy to put together. I recommend to anyone at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Max Weight is Not 230 🤨
customer_reviews.text: Welp...I’ve had this 2 mos and have it to my 90lb girlfriend this morning. She would give it 5 stars, she’s thrilled. The max weight said 230...I range from 217-223 with clothes and after 4 or 5 minutes, just as I’m getting warmed up...so are the cylinders. At that point they loose most resistance. I had it at max 12 and it was great temporarily. Quality, ease of installation and sturdiness were all spot on. Really good machine for the money. They should probably lower the max weight to 200 or so.
customer_reviews.author: Weirs 42

customer_reviews.title: Cheap BUT affective
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a cheap stepper and still get the same benefits of a more expensive one then this is definitely a good buy. My 14 year old practically put this together by herself I only rearranged how she had the bolts placed with was my own OCD. I put it to work this morning for 10 minutes after my 45 minutes treadmill walk and I stopped several times. What I like is that when you stop the clock stops. This way you aren’t “cheating” yourself out of a full workout.
customer_reviews.author: Chocdrop78

customer_reviews.title: Good workout on a compact machine!
customer_reviews.text: This step machine does the trick. You definitely get a great work out and it was easy to put together! Nice and compact so it doesn’t take up a lot of space! A couple of cons are the metal shock absorbers get really hot if you are on there longer than 10 minutes which isn’t a huge deal. The main con is that my knees kept hitting the machine. The foot pedals are too close. I’m 5’8 so it may not affect anyone shorter. I had to put wrapping around the part that my knees hit so it wouldn’t hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: I was really hesitant to buy this considering the price was much lower than similar machines but I'm SO glad I did. It came 99% assembled, leaving only eight bolts/screws (ignorant to tools, clearly) to secure. I have used the machine everyday since I received it on May 22 2017, 30 minutes at a time. I vary my 'stride' from putting weight on the balls of my feet (gets the calves and lower quad) to my heels (butt and hips). Fyi: I am about 5'3. I will update as time goes by but so far I'm delighted!
customer_reviews.author: B. Gale

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Stepper
customer_reviews.text: The Climbing Stepper arrived quickly, was a piece of cake to put together (just need to connect the hydraulic arms to the "steps", connect the handle and plug a wire into the "computer") and works great. There are literally only 6 hex bolts that need to be "installed". A little bolt wrench and allen wrench comes with it. I had it together in about 10 minutes. Works very well. I tried it at "1" which had quite a bit of resistance. Will probably need to stay at that level a few times before being able to work up to the next level. Stepper looks very sturdy and well made, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting some folding home equipment for a while, as I live in a small space, and figured I'd give this a try. Assembly was very easy, no missing or damaged parts. I've been using it 6 days a week for the past two months and it seems to be holding up well. Definitely needs a bit of oiling, but works exactly as I was hoping it would. I'm giving it a 4/5 stars because it doesn't fold enough to fit in the place I originally intended, but it DOES fold and can fit into my closet when I'm done for the day.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: For what it is, and what you expect when you spend so little on a piece of gym equipment - it does not disappoint. Cheap, works well, easy to put together (probably took me all of ten minutes), doesn’t take up much room at all. Only downside is your feet kind of slip forward, so you have to mind your feet placement. I hit my knees on the bars a couple of times, I imagine someone taller than me (5’4”) would hit their knees pretty easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer D Patton

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control means dangerously unstable
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this machine for how compact and portable it is, but when I unpacked and assembled it, the frame was clearly warmed to the point of dangerous instability (see video). I contacted Sunny directly as they requested and after 2 days they told me to contact Amazon. I was issued a refund with minimal hassle and they were stocked out of this model so I ordered another brand that hopefully is assembled with better quality control. Thanks for wasting my time.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product to reduce some trips to the gym which were specifically to use a stair stepper for my lower back-chiropractor recommendation. So far, I love it! It has a great range of tensions and the range of motion in height is sufficient for what I need. Looking forward to regular use!
customer_reviews.author: Tabledweller

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Simplicity is sometimes better when it comes to design and that is definitely the case with this stepper. Minimal assembly and I was up and climbing in a half hour. Broke a sweat after 10 minutes of workout and really felt my quads flexing. Watch out for the pistons. They get really hot from the friction so don't touch after working out. For only a hundred bucks I couldn't ask for anything more. Beats the treadmill and the exercise bike hands down.
customer_reviews.author: David Brotman

customer_reviews.title: Great Stepper, Easy Assembly
customer_reviews.text: This arrived MUCH faster than the stated delivery date. This is my second Sunny Health machine (other is the row and ride) and both were very easy to put together even as someone who isn’t very inclined in assembly. Especially for the price, this is a sturdy machine but also light enough to move around if you wanted to. I can feel it in my quads and glutes but I expect if I played around with position and speed, I could feel it in the total lower body. I have used it around the mid resistance levels as a beginner. Very good addition for cardio and lower body strength.
customer_reviews.author: SunshineAZ20

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Product does not sit level on floor. When used it rocks back and forth making it difficult and uncomfortable to exercise. Attempted to contact support@sunnyhealthfitness.com but email returned stating invalid address.
customer_reviews.author: David Fiez

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful stair-stepper exerciser. I normally dislike any kind of exercise, but know I have to do some. I'm a senior citizen, and moderate exercise is essential. Since cancelling my gym membership because of Covid-19, I've been taking neighborhood walks, but that's miserable in the summer heat. I decided to try this stair-stepper, and I love it! I can watch TV while using it, and it works my leg muscles much better than just walking. Younger people might prefer the electric stair-steppers that make you move fast. This one doesn't make you move fast, but it's perfect for me!
customer_reviews.author: Julie N. McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Good for cardio
customer_reviews.text: I’m making full use of this product as a cardio machine and Spend an average of 2-3 hours on it per week. It tends to have a burning smell after 30 minutes if I push hard so I know it’s not going to last long. The pedal is comfortable and I sometimes do cardio wearing just my slippers. Good value for money though and suits my needs at the moment! I’d buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Sal

customer_reviews.title: Do the people who design equipment like this consider all the potential users? I think not.
customer_reviews.text: It seems very sturdy, especially for the price. But it's quite hard to push even on 1 and the pedals/steps are both sitting at almost kneecap height when resting, making it difficult to get on and start stepping. I had another stepper and when one step was up the other was down. And the treads on the steps caught the treads on my sneakers and I almost fell sideways. I will try to figure a way to make it more user-friendly but if I can't it will be returned.
customer_reviews.author: suziQ

customer_reviews.title: Great machine to get stronger legs!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this stair stepper. I am 61 and in decent shape for my age or so I thought! I lasted 5 minutes on level one before I had to take a break! Definitely a good sturdy piece of equipment for the home. I alternate my 30 minutes of workout with this Stepper and Sunny’s Ride and Row machine. When my legs get fatigued on the stepper I move on over to the ride and row and then back again. Great leg and cardio workout. Eventually I will get to at least 15 minutes on each. You can’t go wrong as this machine. It is well built and is affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Ginny

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy equipment. Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Started out exhausted after only five minutes. Built up to 20 minutes a day within a week. Now doing an hour a day, in two 30-minute sessions. Losing weight and inches all over, initially in abdomen, and noticeable in first week. Sturdy equipment. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: 50+ homeschooling mom

customer_reviews.title: Finally
customer_reviews.text: after ordering several steppers from Amazon I FINALLY found one that I have been looking for .. I LOVE this stepper.. It is very Sturdy, Strong and Durable ... I Love working out on it I can NOT say enough good things about this stepper I am a real person and I am not being paid to say this
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Gilchriest

customer_reviews.title: Kept me moving during quarantine
customer_reviews.text: I live in NYC and purchased this while in quarantine during the pandemic because I live in a small apartment and couldn’t get out to exercise. What a great purchase! It is slim and discreet so it fits nicely into any small space. I was relieved at how easy it was to put together. Everything you needed was included. It’s super quiet and had several settings to increase intensity. Great price as well.
customer_reviews.author: Target Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good quality. This is a great machine. It was easy to put together (In under ten minutes, one person). It is easy to move around. Changing the resistance couldn't be simpler. It is sturdy. If you are looking for a nice little stepper to get a good cardiovascular workout going, this is a fantastic, inexpensive choice. The computer isn't super accurate (but they never are. Buy a workout watch if you want an accurate count of calories burned), but I never go by the computer anyway so that didn't matter to me. I like it enough that I am buying it for family members for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: J.Gad

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad for the Price
customer_reviews.text: It works as something to get some exercise at home. Assembly was very easy. Works well. Some things to note though - 1.there is something for your hands to hold on to, but your arms don't move unless you were to balance and have dumbbells. 2. The two steps are not connected in any way, so you have to find the pace that works for you to have both your legs stepping in sync.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Smith

customer_reviews.title: Sunny Folding Step Climber
customer_reviews.text: Adjustable resistance, and does what climbers many times it's price can't do. Did I mention it has adjustable resistance? And it takes up a small amount of space!? Great investment for those who don't have a lot of space,nor a lot of time for a supplemental leg workout in addition to your weight training! Who needs a Stair Master? Save your wallet!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Turner

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stepper
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite satisfied with this machine. Easy to assemble. Very sturdy. Excellent resistance. Very reasonable price. Also, most important, you can purchase replacement parts when things break. This, in my opinion, is their best stepper because it offers adjustable resistance and the resistance is great, unlike their twist stepper which provides little resistance. Why this model is no longer available is a complete mystery to me. I would purchase this again. I would not purchase the twist stepper.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond M. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: The counter might not work
customer_reviews.text: I love this item!! But only two stars because the counter came defective. It turns on but won’t connect to the stepper and there’s no way to fix it, and too much of a hassle to return such a big item.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: Super impressed
customer_reviews.text: This just arrived and I have to say that so far I’m super impressed. Hardly any assembly, just a few nuts and bolts. It’s really stable and feels very solid. It’s very compact and can be folded away. The difficulty is adjustable so I put it on 1 for going fast and then higher for a slower but harder workout. I’ll update this review after I’ve used it a few times but right now it’s definitely worth what I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Cace F.

customer_reviews.title: I love this little stair step machine
customer_reviews.text: I love this little stair step machine. I've used it a few times a week for most of the summer and it still works like new. It's not anything fancy, just your basic exercise machine, but it does the job. It is fairly noisy with squeaking and whatnot, but I can't hear it through my headphones, so I'm not bothered by it. I do wish it folded down a little flatter. Even folded all the way down, the handle piece still takes up too much room for me to be able to fit this under my bed. Not a huge deal though.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Hydraulics issues - no workout
customer_reviews.text: I contacted the manufacturer and then Amazon that the hydraulics we're damaged. They don't extend in any combination or turning the tension dial and both hydraulics.s are defective. The support staffer Mihaela. Requested photos of issue, still waiting for a reply day 3.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic machine even if you’re fit and strong
customer_reviews.text: 1. Affordable 2. Space saving folds into size of an ironing board. 3. Adjustable- I’m a strong 270lb man and on the right settings was able to do a HIIT workout on this machine. Really tests cardio and builds strength in legs without knee strain or impact. At the same time this can be adjusted for grandmothers, kids ladies doesn’t matter. Can’t recommend this highly enough. Been using it for 4mos and it’s very solid.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my purchase. I got this to get back into shape. I admit that I find this a bit strenuous for my fitness level, but I think I will enjoy it for the years to come. Before buying this I was considering a treadmill. But I didn't buy one because of the bulk involved. I wanted something that is compact, and I don't regret it even if I don't use it as much as I hope (which happens with many of us :) ). One plastic piece was broken on delivery, but was promptly replaced by the customer service.
customer_reviews.author: smsb

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: My commercial grade stepper died so I got this to use until I can find a new one. For the price it’s very functional. Assembly was easy. It doesn’t take up much space. Wish it had a rack you could attach to hold a book or magazine.
customer_reviews.author: Nanf

customer_reviews.title: First steps to healthier life
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to set up, got it turned around a little but that was user error trying to figure the order of screw washer nut. For the price this is amazing. It also saves a ton of space. I started with 10 min goal and would start and stop in the beginning, I liked that it only tracked when I was using it so no cheating letting the clock run while I lay on the group dying for breath.
customer_reviews.author: Shellie Lynn Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: So worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This is great for the price! I rarely write reviews, but this is worth it! I’m never going back to the gym! This took less that 20 minutes to assemble, and it was super easy. It works really well. It’s simple-you have to twist knobs to change the level, but it works really well. I have used it all week, and I’m super happy with it. It’s makes a little noise, but my kids watched a movie in the same room I was exercising, and it didn’t bother them. I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Josh P

customer_reviews.title: Great for what it is. Runner here.
customer_reviews.text: First off, very easy to assemble. This thing is HARD! And I’m a long distance runner. Also, I use a gym stair master and elliptical regularly. This is quite different. The range of motion is different from usual gym machines. But this does the trick for sure! If you’re looking for a cheap machine that WORKS for cardio and elevates your heart rate, this is it!!
customer_reviews.author: Kerri

customer_reviews.title: Easy on joints
customer_reviews.text: Easy on joints and perfect if you live in an apartment where noise issue can be a sensitive subject. It's quiet enough to work out in the middle of the night. It seems easy but just 5 minutes on it gets me sweaty. Perfect cardio machine. It's easy to put together, without any other tools than what's given to you, and it comes in with screws in place (you just need to add the knots and tighten it).
customer_reviews.author: C. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Display Console doesn't detect motion > Issue resolved
customer_reviews.text: The following issue was resolved. The company has an excellent customer support team. The magnet sensor was missing, so they sent it quickly. __________________________________ I just assembled SF-1115 today. The display console doesn’t detect motion. I can turn it on and it displays “0”. The display doesn’t detect even I begin pedaling, so it turns off after several minutes even I keep pedaling. I did “reset” several times and removed the battery, but they don’t help. I am thinking to return but if Sunny's customer support can help me diagnose the problem quickly I might keep it.
customer_reviews.author: isbdincool

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for at home cardio. Challenging enough.
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine. Perfect for me. I’m an IFBB bikini pro and gotta get my cardio in everyday. This was inexpensive and works great. But, I will say, I’m petite at 5’3 and sub 100lbs so I’m not sure how effective it is for much larger folks. It works for me in part bc I’m lightweight. But it’s sturdy adjustable and as hard as you want it to be. After a month I’ve noticed some improvements. Great for home gym.
customer_reviews.author: K. C. Abate

customer_reviews.title: In love! Tones/strengthens legs+glutes, makes me break a serious sweat! Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Love this stepper! The resistance is good, step is high, it’s stable enough for me (5’4 @ 150lbs) and tones and strengthens legs and glutes. I break a serious sweat after 10 minutes and my heart rate is up on this one. Good cardio and strength if combo 👍🏽
customer_reviews.author: Ray Parke

customer_reviews.title: Good, but smelly
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, but after about 15 minutes, it begins to give off a very potent smell of lubricant. I don’t think breathing that stuff in is too healthy.
customer_reviews.author: TinyTina

customer_reviews.title: Light and hard
customer_reviews.text: It is amazingly tiring. It wasn't hard to assemble. While it doesn't look sexy but it is light enough to pick up and move. We keep it in living room and use it while watching TV. So far we can barely do more than 10 minutes on it at a time. But when we have guests coming we just pick it up and put in garage.
customer_reviews.author: Amer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent step climber for daily cardio work outs!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I need for the cardio portion of my daily work out. Climbing stairs every day is proven to be better than walking or running or riding a bike. On average I climb 1500 stairs each day knowing weight loss is achievable with anything over a thousand steps per day. I will definitely be using this every day with my situps and ab-circles.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Escobedo

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to put together, easy to hide in a closet
customer_reviews.text: For someone who can't build Ikea furniture, I was able to put this thing together well in about 20 mins. I love how you can modify the intensity and the bottom feet twist so you can make sure it's sturdy. 10/10 recommend for the price and how easily you can fold and hide in a closet. I'm also not really concerned about the computer tracker thing, I just make sure to turn on my apple watch or fitbit while I'm using it to track my heart rate.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I need but it can be more perfect
customer_reviews.text: Added this step master to my home gym backyard list and so far I’m loving it, it doesn’t take up much space and it does it’s job. However, I’ve been using it for a few weeks now and the screw on one the of side step keeps coming off and I had to secure it back on multiple times myself, I guess I’ll have to call customer service to see if they can give me some new parts on that... have no idea why the screw keeps coming off as well. Other than that, everything else is as described and I’m satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Great for new mom!
customer_reviews.text: This is not a professional piece of exercise equipment. IT IS a compact and effective way to get yourself moving. I am 5 month post partum and starting to try to get back in shape. I bought this for my living room so I can watch the baby while he plays and get some extra fitness time in without needing a schedule or daycare. It took my husband 15 min to out together. I hopped on for 5 minutes and I already have noodle legs! Definitely recommend if you're looking for something small, but effective to use while you are stuck at home!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: "Brain" Not Functioning
customer_reviews.text: I like this product's portability. I was able to take this stair stepper on vacation. However, I have only begun to use it regularly, and the "brain" is no longer working properly. I changed the batteries. But that didnt improve the function. It is not keeping time properly and sometimes shuts off during a workout. I am going to contact the manufacturer to see if I can get this matter resolved. I will do an update later.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah S. Sturm

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Value! Glad I purchased it!
customer_reviews.text: Saw the great reviews and wanted to buy this..but it was sold out. Found it back in stock and decided to take the chance. Good choice. I definitely get a respectable workout. Great for the money. Folds up nicely in my city apartment. Great value for the low price. Note, the front pistons gets hot so just don’t try to move it right after you are done.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: It felt super unstable being on this the whole time
customer_reviews.text: I guess I had too high of expectations for this. It felt super unstable being on this the whole time. I'm a pretty inshape guy and was looking for a piece of at home cardio equipment for the mornings and when I don't feel like hitting the gym. Mine made a weird noise the whole time I was using it. Maybe it was defective, but I just didn't like it and it didn't fit what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Tallavas

customer_reviews.title: Legs and buns
customer_reviews.text: Man o man, I wanted something simple and easy to use to get a decent work out in at home. This is solid! After 10 mins I was huffing and puffing. Recommend for anyone that wants to get a quick simple workout in !
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little stepper. I got it just for something I can do while I’m watching tv to get a workout in for days I don’t go to the gym. This thing surprisingly kicks my butt. The different difficulty levels are awesome. It really gets my heart pumping in a very short amount of the time. Not to mention I can really feel the burn in my glutes and thighs the second I get off this. The counter/timer is very basic, but for the price you really can’t beat this product.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice machine especially for the price. Easy to assemble - after reading the instructions. Fairly light and easy to move around. My previous stepper broke and this one is an excellent replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: After using the stepper for a few weeks, I've lost a lot of weight. It was hard at first, but it got easier as days went by. Also, Sunny Health & Fitness customer service was great! I would definitely buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: CyberDrago

customer_reviews.title: Digital Counter does not work
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by how smooth the stepping motion is, but the digital counter does not work. Even if it did, I'm not sure how long it would last, because it seems cheaply made. To be clear, the counter turns on, but it does not start counting or timing as the instruction manual says it will. I can't be sure, but I think the problem is with the internal wiring that connects the counter to the steps. It doesn't keep me from using it, but it is annoying that I paid for a feature that does not work.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: Best 100 bucks I ever spent
customer_reviews.text: Best 100 bucks I ever spent. I am an old man who lost his butt muscles and was having back problems. This simple machine has been great for both problems and I've only had it a month. Sturdy, functional, easy to assemble and use-I could not recommend it more. SoCal oldtimer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy Button Approved
customer_reviews.text: This equipment has an easy button (meaning ease of assembly and use). Opening the box, all the pieces just had minor assembly with the included tools. Within 5 minutes, I started using it. I wanted a basic stair stepper that would be easy to use every day. This equipment delivered that need. Great purchase, delivery, and assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Good for small spaces, nice home workout equipment
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy little stepper machine for a smaller space. Works smoothly and is adjustable. Lightweight and easy to move around. Good for a space with lower ceilings such as an older basement.
customer_reviews.author: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: As Great as all the Reviews say it is.
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect at home stepper. I have a gym membership, but most times I workout with the weights and machines. Leaving no time for cardio. This is great to use while watching tv. I would recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Lou.

customer_reviews.title: better on her knees then other things
customer_reviews.text: So writing this for wife and she likes it and uses it all the time. better on her knees then other things.
customer_reviews.author: Murray family

customer_reviews.title: Rehab for a bum leg
customer_reviews.text: Since the gyms/pools are closed I had to go to plan B which was a home exercise regimen and my budget was tight so I bought this stepper and I am very happy with the results. I have 12 screw in my left leg due to an accident a year ago so this stair stepper is a great way to build muscle and tone my legs, no regrets
customer_reviews.author: Glenna McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Stepper
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’2” and 140 lbs. and this has been the greatest buy!! I was concerned that it would become a towel and clothes holder....but that’s on me. I used to workout and a couple of years ago I couldn’t so going back was tough.... I needed something to get me started and motivated again. This was perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Jax

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: I have used this almost every day since purchase. It says not to use it for more than fifteen minutes at a time, but I am doing 30-45 each time I use it and it's holding up great.
customer_reviews.author: heidi weiser

customer_reviews.title: if you want a counter - don't buy this machine
customer_reviews.text: If you want a counter - don't buy this machine,I bought two of them - right out of the box neither counter worked- I assume the manufacturer knows it and does not care.
customer_reviews.author: NYC

customer_reviews.title: This thing will kick your butt!
customer_reviews.text: The definition of easy... to assemble and store. And, it's amazingly well built... and a killer work out. I had dual knee replacement about four years ago, and this is finally getting my legs back in working order. Just get it.
customer_reviews.author: Scrannel

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. It’s a real workout and has held up well for months of use. A little squeaky but not noticeable when your listening to music or watching tv
customer_reviews.author: stornetn

customer_reviews.title: senior strong
customer_reviews.text: I'm a stroke survivor and its has helped me too walk again. Stepping was missing from my walking routine. With the climber I am able to strengthen my thighs which helps in walking, stepping and climbing. And continence!
customer_reviews.author: gamehammer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but needs work
customer_reviews.text: I like this and would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a inexpensive option for a stepper just realize that it's not a commercial one. The tension comes from two pneumatic door closers basically and the tension is at fist hard as a rock then when it heats up very little.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Ok.  Cylinders could be better.  mine are uneven when warm
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Shipped fast. Set-up was very easy. It's stable, and QUIET! Well, I have now noticed that once side is higher than the other after using it for a few minutes. The cylinder on the left doesn't go all the way up. it stops leaving one inch of the inside bar visible. The right side is fine. I'm not sure what to do about this. I don't see where I can get a replacement cylinder. The whole thing doesn't need to be replaced, just that one part. Who do I call for that? I don't see any options. Also the computer doesn't reset itself. The frame is fine.
customer_reviews.author: B. Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: With about a year of use, about 1-2 hours of use a week, this appears to be a simple and well-manufactured device. It's not the most perfect device, being a little small and not having the most comfortable position for use, but it provides a basic and useful step workout. It is also extremely compact and easily folds flat if you need to keep it out of the way when it's not in use. It's a simple matter of puling three pins and a few flips. Not a professional machine, but good if you need something for home use and you don't have a lot of space.
customer_reviews.author: D. Poms

customer_reviews.title: Good leg workout
customer_reviews.text: Good item for the price. But unfortunately its a little bit more than i need. It offers a real good leg workout. I just need something a little less strenuous and a little smaller. So I returned it and went with the smaller stepper. It took up a little more space than I wanted even when folded. And I hit my knees on the upper shock mount, ouch.
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: good cardio
customer_reviews.text: i like the stepper is a good cardio. If u got any problem with the stepper.dont returned.to amazon.u can get new parts on sunny health with the guarranty of the machine. I got problem with the computer..but sunny h.send me a new one really fast.and im really happy
customer_reviews.author: elvira

customer_reviews.title: Hydraulics only lasted one year.
customer_reviews.text: I liked this climber but one of the hydraulics only lasted 1 year, and that's only after I started using it more regularly. I would like to find a replacement hydraulic possibly from a different company if anyone knows of one that would work.
customer_reviews.author: B. Me

customer_reviews.title: Unstable
customer_reviews.text: Nice size and easy to assemble. The bar on the bottom that touches the floor for support is VERY wobbley. I flop from side to side while using the machine. It does not fit flush to the floor.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great product for aerobic indoor workout during the pandemic
customer_reviews.text: Product was easy to assemble and has worked really well. The issue I had was that a little oil dripped from one of the shafts so I had to put a plastic sheet under the apparatus. The sheet also keeps sweat from dripping on the carpet beneath the apparatus.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Cooke

customer_reviews.title: Yes for my new booty
customer_reviews.text: It works. If I want to be lazy and watch YouTube videos I get on this while I do it. Helps pass time in a positive way!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Larusso

customer_reviews.title: Adequate stepper, terrible packaging.
customer_reviews.text: Received my stepper today, it seems to be an adequate machine but the packaging was terrible, the box was damaged and the plastic piece where the counter computer goes was broken. Was able to finagle the counter into place and throw a little super glue on and it's fine I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsaytron

customer_reviews.title: love this
customer_reviews.text: easy to assemble and although once you use it , it has a weird metal smell but it does the job! good purchase for the money and now i can watch tv without feeling like a blob lol
customer_reviews.author: eve

customer_reviews.title: Great if you're short!
customer_reviews.text: This is surprisingly well made for the price and surprisingly provides a decent stepping workout. I am 5'2" and 118 lbs and it fits me really well however, my husband is 6'4" and his knees ran into the hydraulic posts - definitely not for tall people!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hoping it would last awhile but after a month the foot of the stair climber would no longer go to the top. I tried to have them replace it and it had just past the 30 days. I would nor recommend this machine if you use it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: ... part that adjusts the settings) but customer service was AWESOME and are sending me the replacement part
customer_reviews.text: My machine broke (the part that adjusts the settings) but customer service was AWESOME and are sending me the replacement part. The machine is easy to put together and worked well, and once I get the replacement piece I have no doubt it will continue to work well... Seriously the company has the best customer service I've ever dealt with, and they want the customer to be happy and they back up the quality of their machine.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Ain't no joke!
customer_reviews.text: This stepper is no joke. If you are out of shape, even level one can be difficult. It's a calf burner for sure! Great workout. Looked small when I put it together, but it's very stable and works great!
customer_reviews.author: H. Bokor

product_meta.title: Sunny Health & Fitness Stair Stepper Exercise Equipment Step Machine for Exercise - SF-1115
product_meta.description: Step into the right path with the Sunny Health & Fitness Folding Stair Stepper Exercise Equipment Step Machine! Affordable, calorie-blasting, and body sculpting workout enables you to perform both cardio and muscle toning all in the comfort of your own home. The stair climbing machine works your gluteus maximus, hamstrings, quads and core muscle groups at the same time, maximizing your time! Traditional steppers have two platforms, or pedals, where you place your feet. As you push one foot plate down, the other foot plate will rise, only putting to work one leg at a time. With this Climbing Stepper each pedal works independently working both legs and core at the same time
feature_bullets: CONVENIENT: Unlike other exercise equipment, this climbing stepper is simple in design and a real space saver. It is slim and lightweight so that you can fit it in any corner of the house
TRACK YOUR FITNESS: Easy to read and informative, you will be able to see your progress and meet new goals! LCD monitor tracks your calories, scan, time and count
DUAL HYDRAULIC: Heavy-duty hydraulic piston cylinders have easy-to-adjust incline settings from 1 to 12 to increase or decrease tempo
STABILITY: This sturdy climber machine supports weight up to 220lbs. The stepper contains patterned plates to prevent any possible slips
EASY STORAGE: When you’re not using it, the Climbing Stepper folds and stores in any corner or closet

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
